greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A triangular array of numbers related to factorization and number of parts in Murasaki diagrams.
comment: When the Bell multisets are encoded as described in A130274, the seven case in the example can be coded as 19578, 15942, 30873, 26427, 35642, 29491 and 32938.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10011
formula: Equals A048993 * A000012. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 29 2008
That is, T(i,j) = Sum_{k=j..i} A048993(i,k) for 0 <= j <= i. - _Robert Israel_, Nov 01 2018
example: a(14) = 7 because only seven of the 52 Bell multisets can be generated by attaching a new stroke to the third element in the set of diaqrams with four strokes.
maple: b:= proc(n, t) option remember; `if`(n>0, add(b(n-j, t+1)*
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(b(n, 0)):
mathematica: row[n_] := Table[StirlingS2[n, k], {k, 0, n}] // Reverse // Accumulate // Reverse;
xref: Cf. A000110 (row sums), A137650 (a similar triangle), A130274, A211561.
results.author: _Alford Arnold_, Sep 18 2007
ext: Definition not clear to me - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 18 2007
